subsections.title: Identify External and Internal Issues
questions: Which federal, regional, or local laws and regulations must be observed (e.g., fire protection, occupational safety, hazardous materials management)?
Who monitors compliance with these requirements and how is it documented and communicated?
How are current industry trends (digitalization, home office, hybrid work models) integrated into occupational health and safety?

subsections.title: Interested Parties and Their Requirements
questions: Must authorities or professional associations be regularly informed about personnel changes (e.g., change of OHS officer)?
What requirements do employees and external service providers have regarding cooperation with officers?

subsections.title: Scope of the OHS Management System
questions: Is the scope clearly defined?
Are all work areas and processes included where occupational safety specialists or other officers must be deployed?
Are freelancers or temporary workers considered regarding occupational safety requirements?

subsections.title: Management System and Interfaces
questions: How are the interactions between different officers (e.g., OHS, data protection, quality) ensured?
Are roles and responsibilities at the interfaces clearly defined?

subsections.title: Responsibility and Commitment of Top Management
questions: Is there a direct reporting line from OHS officers to top management (regular meetings, reports)?
How does management ensure that officers receive sufficient resources and authority?

subsections.title: Occupational Health and Safety Policy
questions: Is the policy formulated to explicitly include the role and tasks of OHS officers?
Are the participation rights of employees and officers emphasized?

subsections.title: Roles, Responsibilities and Authorities
questions: Are the tasks and competencies of the OHS officer documented (job description, organizational chart)?
How is it ensured that other officers (fire protection, safety officer, occupational physician) are clearly delineated and work in coordination?
Are officers allowed to stop processes when there is acute danger (Stop-Work-Authority)?

subsections.title: Participation and Consultation of Workers
questions: Are officers involved in employee surveys or occupational safety committee meetings?
Is there a structured process for involvement in operational changes?

subsections.title: Special Officers and Expert Functions
questions: Is the role officially appointed and equipped with authority (OHS Officer)?
How is professional competence ensured (continuing education, training)?
Is the legal deployment according to DGUV/ArbSchG complied with and documented (Occupational Safety Specialist)?
How are recommendations forwarded to management?
Are occupational medical examinations planned and conducted (Occupational Physician)?
How is coordination between occupational physician and OHS officer carried out?
Are all fire protection concepts created and current (Fire Protection Officer)?
Are evacuation drills organized?
Are safety officers regularly trained?
Do they have reporting channels for incident reporting?

subsections.title: Actions to Address Risks and Opportunities
questions: Is there a systematic process for risk and opportunity assessment?
Are risks identified that could arise from missing or unqualified officers?
Are there backup arrangements in case of absences?

subsections.title: Legal and Other Requirements
questions: Is there an overview of all obligations and regulations for officers?
Are the obligations of individual officers regularly evaluated and updated?

subsections.title: Occupational Health and Safety Objectives
questions: Are objectives (e.g., accident reduction, ergonomic improvements) defined and evaluated?
How is it handled when objectives are not achieved?

subsections.title: Emergency and Crisis Planning
questions: Are the roles of officers in emergencies defined?
How is accessibility and communication ensured?
Are there emergency plans for personnel absences?

subsections.title: Detailed Objective Planning
questions: Are objectives divided into short, medium, and long-term phases?
Is there alignment of objectives with corporate goals?

subsections.title: Resource Management & Budget
questions: Is there a budget for officers (training, literature, consulting)?
Do officers have sufficient work equipment (measuring devices, software, PPE)?

subsections.title: Competence and Qualification
questions: Are there qualification requirements for each role?
How is continuing education planning managed?

subsections.title: Awareness and Communication
questions: Are new employees informed about roles and accessibility?
Are there newsletters, notices, internal communication about updates?

subsections.title: Documented Information
questions: How are results from officers archived?
Are records (inspection reports, maintenance) systematically stored?

subsections.title: Knowledge Management
questions: How is know-how secured (documentation, wiki, intranet)?
Is there a central repository for OHS information?

subsections.title: Communication & Documentation
questions: How are updates to processes or safety notices communicated?
Are escape routes, inspection seals, etc. regularly checked?
Is there an internal and external communication matrix?

subsections.title: Operational Planning and Control
questions: Are officers involved early in processes (e.g., machinery purchase, new construction)?
Are work processes designed to consider safety?
Are protective measures consistently implemented?

subsections.title: Hazard Assessment & Protective Measures
questions: Are workplaces regularly inspected and documented?
How are employees involved?
Are risk assessments regularly updated?
How is effectiveness verified?

subsections.title: Management of Change
questions: Are there established procedures including OHS risk analysis?
How are employees informed?
Is the OHS officer part of the approval process?
Are TRGS-600 substitution assessments applied?
Are impacts on other officers considered?

subsections.title: Procurement & Supplier Management
questions: Are there procurement guidelines for involving officers?
Must external parties comply with OHS standards and are they monitored?
How is safety coordinated in joint projects?
How are service providers instructed?

subsections.title: Emergency Preparedness and Response
questions: Are first aiders available and trained?
Is there follow-up after emergencies?
Are officers involved in emergency drills?
Is there an alarm plan including contact details?

subsections.title: Maintenance Management
questions: Are there maintenance plans for equipment?
How often are maintenance activities performed?

subsections.title: Operational Control and Process Organization
questions: How are workspaces managed?
Are there tools for space allocation and utilization analysis?

subsections.title: Safety and Health Management
questions: Are safety concepts regularly tested (fire protection, evacuation)?

subsections.title: Sustainability and Environmental Protection
questions: Are environmentally friendly products used?
Are there COâ‚‚ reduction targets in the context of occupational safety?
Is climate change considered in risk and stakeholder analysis?

subsections.title: Monitoring, Measurement, Analysis
questions: Which KPIs (accidents, severity, sickness rate) are used?
Are trends analyzed?

subsections.title: Internal Audits
questions: Is there an audit plan for all areas?
Are unannounced audits conducted?
What is the audit scope?
Are auditors qualified and independent?
How are results evaluated and actions derived?

subsections.title: Management Review
questions: Are OHS performance data systematically reviewed?
Are actions derived from the review?
Are results documented?

subsections.title: Feedback & Learning
questions: Are incidents systematically analyzed?
Are there feedback systems for employees?

subsections.title: Continuous Improvement
questions: Are there procedures for capturing and analyzing non-conformities?
Are measures checked for effectiveness?

subsections.title: Non-conformities & Corrective Actions
questions: Is there a systematic procedure for reporting/processing deviations?
Are corrective actions documented?
Is there a reporting system for incidents?

subsections.title: Management of Psychosocial Risks
questions: Are psychosocial risks captured and preventively addressed?
Is there psychological support after critical events?

subsections.title: Lessons Learned
questions: Are workshops conducted after projects or incidents?
Are findings documented in processes?

subsections.title: Compliance & Ethics
questions: How are OHS compliance requirements implemented?
Are business partners audited?

subsections.title: Innovation and Health Programs
questions: Are digital health, wearables, ergonomic aids evaluated?
Is there a budget for health promotion?

subsections.title: Additional Information
questions: Are definitions for digital health, wearables, AR glasses, exoskeletons documented?
